alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 11:47AM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN COVINGTON AND NORTHERN OKALOOSA COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 AM CST... At 1046 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of Laurel Hill, or 16 miles north of Crestview, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Florala, Laurel Hill, and Lockhart. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
